result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby Lee B. Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 39 days served, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. ***No THC***  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  P&P to notify ther court, in writing, upon dirty UA or proof of posseission/consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobby Lee B. Garcia

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Completion of Representation 
Submitted by Atty Francesco Balistrieri
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F. Balistrieri.   Clerk. M.Burke. DE pleads guilty. Court finds DE guilty. PSI waived. Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 3 years with conditions. Credit for 39 days served if revoked. DE to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Samantha K. and Chris T.

Defendant Bobby Lee B. Garcia appeared with Attorney Francesco J Balistrieri.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 2.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 2 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
